definitions.definition: accepting what happens or what people do without trying to change anything or oppose them

examples.text: He played a passive role in the relationship.
She wore a passive expression on her face as if she didn’t care what happened.
Watching TV is a completely passive activity.
We are passive recipients of information from the world around us.

definitions.definition: connected with the form of a verb used when the subject is affected by the action of the verb, for example He was bitten by a dog.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in sense (2), also in the sense ‘(exposed to) suffering, acted on by an external agency’): from Latin passivus, from pass- ‘suffered’, from the verb pati.
